definition.value: Epigenetic assays that can be used to identify epigenome modifications together with the epigenetic enzymes that regulate it. The epigenetic assays are split in two categories: targeted epigenetic assays and epigenetic profiling assays depending on whether they are used to identify a modifications on a global scale or only measure and identify a predetermined list of targets
Assays that measure a targeted and predetermined subset of the epigenetic modifications in a cell
An assay that quantifies the levels of the acetylated histones in a cell. Acetylated histones are involved in the regulation of chromatin structure and thetranscription factor recruitment
An assay that quantifies the levels of the methylated histones in a cell
An assay that identifies genome-wide DNA binding sites for transcription factors and other proteins
Assays that are used to capture the genome-wide epigenetic modifications in a cell
An assay that is used to determine themethylation marks in a cells genome

ATAC-seq (assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing) is an assay that identifies open-chromatin sites on the whole genome level by using theTn5 transposase, which inserts sequencing adapters into accessible regions of chromatin
A mass spectrometry-based assay that is used to identify and quantify post-translational modifications on histone proteins from bulk chromatin
Assays that identify and quantify cell metabolites (metabolic analytes)
Assays that profile key metabolomic parameters
A high throughput live-cell microarray screening assay that is used to detect metabolic analytes such as oxygen, pH and glucose at the single-cell level
Assays that quantify the expression of a predetermined RNA transcript / set of transcripts
An assay that uses NGS (Next Generation Sequencing) to quantify the expression of the entire RNA transcripts in a cell / cell population

L1000 is a bead-based, high-throughput gene expression assay in which cultured cells are treated with various chemical and genetic perturbations and the corresponding transcriptional responses are measured
An assay that uses barcoded hybridization probes to quantify the expression of RNA transcripts
An array based method that simultaneously measures the expression of tens of thousands of RNA transcripts

label.value: Fluorescence imaging cell cycle state assay
Fluorescence imaging cell growth inhibition assay
Fluorescence imaging multiplex cytological profiling assay

definition.value: A variant of the BRET assay utilizing Nanoluc luciferace, providing higher stability, smaller size, greater separation of donor and acceptor wavelengths, and higher fluorescence intensity, enabling more accurate and precise quantification of protein-protein interactions

A variant of the BRET assay utilizing Nanoluc luciferace, providing higher stability, smaller size, greater separation of donor and acceptor wavelengths, and higher fluorescence intensity, enabling more accurate and precise quantification of protein-small molecule interactions
A specific application of protein-small molecule NanoBRET examining the interaction of small molecules with specific kinases

label.value: Tandem Mass Tag (TMT) MS Protein Quantification

definition.value: A method which determines the permeability of substances from a donor compartment, through a lipid-infused artificial membrane into an acceptor compartment. At the beginning of the test, the drug is added to the donor compartment, and the acceptor compartment is drug-free. After an incubation period the amount of drug is measured in each compartment. Mass balance allows calculation of drug that remains in the membrane. It is used as an in vitro model of passive, transcellular permeation to predict oral absorption. PAMPA is an alternative to the cell-based Caco-2 permeability assay
A variant of a BRET assay wherein fluorescently tagged beta-arrestin2 is detected when in proximity of a G-protein coupled receptor with an Rluc C-terminal tag.

Beta-arrestin2 fused to the TEV protease liberates a tTA molecule fused to the C-terminus of a target G-protein coupled receptor when in close proximity, resulting in a tTA-driven expression of RLuc from a genomic TETO7-RLuc locus.

Measure release of the heterotrimeric G-protein complex from G-protein coupled receptors (GPCRs). When activated GPCRs catalyze the exchange of GDP for GTP in the G-alpha subunit of the Galpha-beta-gamma heterotrimeric complex, resulting in the disassociation of these subunits from the GPCR of interest.
Measures heterotrimer G-protein disassociation using BRET between alpha and gamma subunits.
